author: Staff Reporter
text:
A 52-year-old woman died when a bike ridden by two drunk youths hit her in Devicode village under Palugal police station limits on Friday night.

The bike ridden by S. Nandakumar (20) of Manjalamoodu and an 18-year-old youth from Karode, who were under the influence of liquor, hit R. Shobana, who was standing near her house in Devicode near Kalyakavilai around 8.30 p.m.

Shobana was rushed to the Medical College Hospital in Karode, where she died later.

After hitting Shobana, the bike hit S. Sashank (32) who was talking to a friend on the roadside. It was said that Mr. Sashank was to go abroad for employment on Saturday. While Mr. Sashank sustained minor injuries, the bike riders suffered grievous injuries, and were admitted to the Medical College Hospital in Karode. Nandakumar was later shifted to Thiruvananthapuram Medical College Hospital, and his condition is said to be critical.

The body of the woman was shifted to Kuzhithurai Government Hospital for post-mortem on Saturday morning. Later, it was handed over to the family members, police sources said.

Palugal police have registered a case under Section 304 A (causing death by negligence) of the Indian Penal Code. Further investigations are on.
title: Woman hit by drunk riders, dies
